measured_by: 4-item financial literacy quiz (Big 3 questions plus risk-return item)
justification: "To assess financial literacy, respondents were asked to answer four questions… Three out of the four items were the so-called 'Big 3'… A supplementary question was developed to assess the comprehension of the risk-return tradeoff."
"Financial risk attitude … was measured using a six-item scale retrieved from Kapteyn and Teppa (2011)."

measured_by: Financial risk-aversion subscale of the Kapteyn & Teppa scale
justification: "The instrument is composed of two factors. The first one measures financial risk aversion… Each sub-scale is measured by three items."

measured_by: Financial risk-tolerance subscale of the Kapteyn & Teppa scale
justification: "…the second factor represents financial risk tolerance (e.g., 'I get more and more convinced that I should take greater financial risks…'). Each sub-scale is measured by three items."
"The measure of financial self-efficacy has been assessed with the Financial Self-Efficacy Scale (FSES; Lown, 2011), a single-factor scale composed of six items."
"Levels of individual impulsivity were measured with BIS-15, a 15-item psychometric instrument developed by Spinella (2007)."
"The first one is Motor Impulsivity … representing the tendency to act without thinking (e.g., 'I act on the spur of the moment')."
"…the second factor is Attentional impulsivity … which indicates lack or difficulties in focusing attention."
"…the Non-planning subscale … measures people's lack of concerns about the future (e.g., 'I plan for the future')."

measured_by: Self-reported ownership of stocks, bonds, or mutual funds
justification: "To assess financial market participation, respondents were asked to select, within a list of financial investment products, the assets they were currently investing in… Participants were considered non-investors if they did not own any financial product."
